annotation.TEXT: With Treasure Knight's stage done, there's only one main stage left in the second part of the overworld. Before I move on to that however, there's another bonus stage that appeared on the map just as I finished up bringing back music sheets and buying other upgrades from the first village.

The blue bird heads show up quite a few times in this stage, and they're easily some of the more annoying enemies to deal with. They take several consecutive hits to kill, and they never leave the screen once they start bouncing around in open spaces (they'll actually follow you in accordance to how the screen scrolls, so unless you're somehow going fast enough, they'll always be there until you transition to the next room).

The fight with Mole Knight is a bit more fast paced compared to Treasure Knight. Even then, I still consider Mole Knight to be the easiest of the second set of bosses (even though I once again do a terrible job at showing it). The biggest thing that makes him much easier than the other bosses is that he has a very clear pattern of attacks, despite the fact that he puts new variations on each one as the fight goes on.

Slime bubbles now start to play a role in the stage to some extent. They can be used either to bounce to high places, or used on lava to make it a safe surface for a few moments. They aren't used too much through-out the last half of the stage, but they manage to be pretty involved when they're around.

Mole Knight's stage introduces a few new gimmicks and enemy types, with the latter heavily involving enemies that are immune to attacks from specific angles. The new fire slimes, for example, can't be killed with a down-thrust (attempting to do so only hurts you in the process).

Chester will sell you the Dust Knuckles for 3,000 gold in this stage. The Dust Knuckles can act as a short-range melee weapon against enemies (which in turn can push either you or them back), but can also be used to dig through rows of dirt blocks. Repeated use of it essentially allows you to float in mid-air, so long as there's a block nearby that you can dig through. Also, staying in mid-air for at least 4 seconds with this relic will give you an achievement (as demonstrated in this room, which is probably the easiest place to do so).
